column1: We can start with the Senate passing the Heroes Act. These business owners can’t wait for relief any longer. But we can all go support them now.

This #SmallBusinessSaturday I’m thinking of the countless business owners who have struggled through this pandemic. Some have managed to keep their doors open but others unfortunately haven’t. The government must do more immediately to support them and strengthen our economy.

Happy Thanksgiving from our family to yours! While our celebrations look a bit different this year I hope that we all have the opportunity to reflect and find something to be thankful for. Please continue to stay safe and healthy care for each other and enjoy your holiday! https://t.co/feARDmejj9

I continue to be inspired as I watch this new generation of leadership take the helm. Tiara Burnett Tekesha Martinez and Emily Keller made history this week and I know that they’ll continue to break barriers as they work to improve the city. https://t.co/FD6CYTycWa
One suggestion she made should be revisited: relief programs need automatic triggers to shield suffering people/businesses/local governments from political games.

.@JoeBiden naming Janet Yellen as Secretary of the Treasury is great news. As the pandemic began my first call was to Dr Yellen. Very impressive: knowledgeable creative calm realistic and smart as a whip. https://t.co/Ah4jF1bAl9

.@JoeBiden's picks for his national security team show us once again that he and his administration will govern with competence. With this team we'll be able to strengthen our partnerships around the globe and diligently solve international problems.  https://t.co/Od1VrKc28i

We’re all eager to spend time with our families this holiday season but let’s make sure we put health and safety first. Family gatherings carry a big risk of infection. Take all of the precautions to stay safe wear a mask and maintain social distance. https://t.co/OFwOmGwkw2
Our next aid package MUST directly address the impact on women. I’ll continue working to provide much needed relief and ensure that the government is doing everything we can to support them.

COVID has had a disproportionately devastating economic and social impact on working women mothers and female caregivers and it’s getting worse as our economy struggles and the virus continues to spread. It is affecting every aspect of their lives.  https://t.co/PQ3zbNoIqh

Unfortunately that’s easier said than done for the countless Americans struggling with addiction. COVID is going to have a silver bullet. We’ll have a vaccine and it’s going to be here soon. But there will never be a vaccine for addiction and that’s why I won’t stop fighting.

Whether we’re white Black or Brown Republican Democrat or Independent COVID-19 and addiction are indiscriminate killers. It’s so important for us to ensure that we’re coping in a healthy and productive way as COVID-19 impacts our daily lives. https://t.co/g9mSktz6JF
Things will get worse before they get better and it falls on us to remain vigilant. Wear a mask. Social distance. Do whatever you can to stop the spread. Lives depend on it.

250000 mothers fathers sons and daughters killed by this virus. While we mourn their deaths each of us has the power – and the responsibility – to do our part to prevent any more.  https://t.co/GUPuOs1KPB

I couldn’t be more proud of my friend @CouncilwomanEm. I have no doubt that she’ll be a leader in ending addiction and improving the lives of Hagerstown residents. I’m looking forward to working with her and can’t wait to see what she accomplishes. https://t.co/qeBWsJO9iK

The infection numbers in Western Maryland are deeply concerning and should be viewed as a wake-up call for all of us. We've put together a resource guide to assist you with getting the help you need during this pandemic. Click below for more information. https://t.co/MiLb4wQgmb

This afternoon the House unanimously passed my bill to provide $9 billion to states to fight the opioid and addiction epidemic. This is a big step but I promise that I won't stop fighting until nobody else has to suffer from this horrible disease.

I’m grateful that under a Biden administration the opioid crisis will be given the attention it deserves. Thousands of families will find solace in the fact that we have competent leaders who know how dire this crisis is and will take steps to end it. https://t.co/fbCihbLYkH

As the virus continues to spike in MD I'm thankful that we're using innovative solutions to help stop the spread. The new MD COVID Alert app is a helpful and secure tool to keep all of us healthy and informed. To learn more about the app click below.  https://t.co/mDvOjyBIqS

Unconditional appreciation and praise for @StaceyAbrams whose relentless efforts to register and turn out voters made Georgia blue for Biden-Harris. She shoulda been Governor but undeterred helped make a President in the wake of a tragic injustice. https://t.co/M93Q8rx3Ds
To those who stood strong in the face of racism and voter suppression to make their voices heard thank you. This historic moment happened because of you.

Democrats should never forget who made this possible: the countless people who organized in their communities and provided energy to the Biden-Harris ticket. Their leadership and determination to create progress should bring all of us hope. https://t.co/38vTNR5gUZ

Shame (again) on Majority Leader McConnell and others standing in the way of meaningful relief legislation. People are dying. Mental health is suffering. Businesses are at the brink. Families are disrupted. Posturing does nothing to help. It’s time to act. https://t.co/8o3uPT4NQ1

Thank you veterans. Today and every day I'm grateful for the sacrifices you made in service to your country. It's my honor to represent you in Washington and it's my commitment that I'll work to ensure that the country you so bravely served continues to serve you.

Today I'm optimistic. We'll soon have leaders dedicated to solving the critical issues we face like the COVID-19 pandemic the addiction crisis our health and mental health and improving our education system. I am confident we will accomplish this.  https://t.co/991tQCGhsI

We must work harder to ensure that women especially women of color are provided equal opportunities to succeed. I know that Vice President-elect Harris will be a champion for that cause and I’ll be happy to stand by her side.

Kamala Harris’ victory is a remarkable point of progress for America. This sends a clear message to women and girls across the nation: there is nothing you can’t achieve. But while we celebrate this historic moment there is much more to be done.  https://t.co/h6SOOD7S3o

I’m hopeful for our country. I know without a doubt that President-elect Biden will lead us into a more prosperous and just future. There’s a lot of work to be done but I couldn’t be happier to be on the Biden-Harris team. Together we will accomplish so much.

History will show that this year we fought to restore our democracy and turn our country around. We made it known that compassion competence and civility matter. We established that American lives are more important than egos and partisan fighting. https://t.co/nNjEUm621b
Congressman Lewis is sorely missed; but I’m thankful that his spirit of tenacity and determination lives on.

John Lewis is still making GOOD TROUBLE. Clayton County the heart of his Congressional district put Biden in the lead in GA. He led the charge for justice and equality in this country and it is fitting that his legacy is doing the same in this election. https://t.co/Ctxrlcu5zZ
Most of all we will continue to serve with compassion civility and competence and to speak out for the people whose voices are seldom heard in the halls of our federal government.

We will continue our efforts on issues that make a difference in the lives of our constituents: fighting the opioid crisis giving mental health the attention it deserves increasing funding for medical research strengthening education and reforming the criminal justice system.
The coming months will mark a major transition in our government and our politics and we will ensure that the interests of this district are represented as those changes are made.

Thank you! I cannot tell you how much I appreciate that the voters of Maryland’s Sixth District have elected me to a second term as their Representative. Every hour of every day my team and I work to justify the trust placed in us by the people who live here.

Thanks to my good friends @amfriedson @fraserfor15 @brianjfeldman and @LilyQiMaryland for the support! Partnering with excellent local and state leaders is the best way to make a real impact in our communities. https://t.co/ztHbvxHSSa
Saw some familiar faces in Frederick! Thanks to @JanGardnerExec @AldermanWilson @CitizenMOC @KarenLewisYoung and @KenKerr3B for stopping by. Polls are open until 8! https://t.co/fCYDpIHMVZ

I was especially humbled to speak with Mark Wilks as he voted for the very first time. His entrepreneurship and mentorship of so many in the community is a shining example of the importance of second chances. I'm honored to call him my friend. https://t.co/DZD9L80nBN
Great time in Hagerstown with my friends @CouncilwomanEm and Tiara Burnett. People are energized and lines are moving quickly! #VOTE https://t.co/M4gT6AGMjZ
In Hagerstown with our next mayor @CouncilwomanEm! https://t.co/v3MNCWUlmm
Started the day bright and early in Garrett and Allegany counties. It was great to join @wcbcradio for an interview. It’s a beautiful day to get out and VOTE! 🗳 https://t.co/6GsoOYBeP5
Polls are open in Maryland! Stand up and make your voice heard today! Click below to find where you can vote. https://t.co/niPIwo6Sup

It's not too late to vote! Early Voting continues today until 8pm and polls are open tomorrow from 7am-8pm. If you are voting in person your polling place may have changed. Be sure to click the link below and double check your information! https://t.co/kpypsTFZzp

Last night we turned our clocks back on Tuesday we turn our country forward! Thanks to @EvanMGlass for stopping by Germantown Early Voting this morning! Remember to make your voice heard there’s too much at stake! https://t.co/mT9F9ir0B2

Don’t be tricked voting early is a treat! Team Trone spent their Halloween at Early Voting sites across the district today. Polls are open tomorrow from 7am until 8pm make sure to stop by and say hello! https://t.co/1tZY1pGklA

We're just 4 days away from taking back our democracy and moving our country forward. Let's keep up the fight and win up and down the entire ballot. There's too much at stake and every vote matters. https://t.co/WIDXJoDpsM

Great to be in Hagerstown this morning with my friends @CouncilwomanEm and @peterperini! Thanks to @mddems Chairwoman Yvette Lewis for stopping by as well. Democrats in Washington County are energized and excited! https://t.co/ix23SJFLcr

Long lines for the first day of early voting but the energy and excitement couldn't have been higher! Great to cast my vote and spend the day talking with voters across the district. Early Voting Centers are open all week. Find a location near you here: https://t.co/D5dYy6DCFN https://t.co/mQYgr2WFfI
These communities make incredible contributions to our country every day. It's time that we do our part to make sure they're safe and healthy.

The truth is Black and Latinx neighborhoods have seen higher numbers of unemployment food insecurity and evictions throughout this pandemic. These families have been left behind by our government for decades and COVID-19 has made it even worse.  https://t.co/RlPY8H2Oxi
What the President says is the “light at the end of the tunnel” turns out to be a freight train headed straight at us. Please continue to take this seriously.  https://t.co/y8YU1D2avw

The truth always prevails over lies. @JoeBiden showed us that tonight. In this debate we saw two drastically different plans laid out for the future of our country. I'm proud to be on the team fighting for healthy families better education and a stronger economy. #BidenHarris

I built a multi-billion dollar business operating in 27 states. Take it from me: a $15 minimum wage is good for business workers and our economy. Anyone who says differently is lying to you. #BidenHarris

Today I learned from small business owners in Hagerstown how they're adapting during COVID-19. Businesses like these are the backbone of our economy. It’s time for the President and the Senate to quit stalling and support these entrepreneurs. https://t.co/oPWxO83LI1

The candidates must be asked about the addiction and mental health crisis during the next debate. This is a huge problem that is getting worse every day and impacting countless families across the country. RT if you agree. https://t.co/wH1ivNErtT

Many states are being crushed by COVID-19: ND “is leading the nation in new coronavirus cases per capita hospitalizations and deaths are at a high.“ We’re better than that. Let’s keep it up. Be safe. Follow the experts not ideologues. And wear a mask. https://t.co/1BqkWHMMYN

TODAY is the last day to request a mail-in ballot. If you haven't already make sure that your local Board of Elections receives your request by the end of the day. This election is too important for our voices not to be heard. For more info click below. https://t.co/YaqmOH0szQ
I trust Dr. Fauci to tell the truth and keep us safe. Pass it on. https://t.co/4BYVSmPvtN

The opioid crisis doesn’t discriminate. It’s taking lives in every zip code and COVID-19 is only making it worse. Unfortunately there’s no vaccine being developed to end this epidemic. In Congress I’ll continue to work to end this crisis and save lives. https://t.co/nCeGLg2JGT
He is sorely missed but his legacy is an important reminder of what we can accomplish even when faced with adversity.

A year ago today America lost one of this generation’s strongest voices for equality and justice Congressman Elijah Cummings. Elijah’s courageous work undoubtedly made our country a better place for all of us and I am forever grateful to have known him.

Making prescription drugs more affordable is essential to protecting the health of seniors and those with pre-existing conditions. I’m proud to work with our community partners in Western Maryland to ensure that they get the funding they need to keep everyone safe and healthy.

COVID-19 combined with the Trump administration’s attempts to gut healthcare means it’s more important now than ever to ensure that rural communities have access to the life-saving treatments they need. https://t.co/KI0VLolg1C

TODAY is the deadline to register to vote in Maryland. There is too much at stake for us to sit this election out. Will you double check your voter registration today and remind 5 friends or family members to do the same? Click below for more information. https://t.co/niPIwo6Sup

No matter what your coming out journey looks like you are loved today and every day. You have my promise that I'll continue to fight for you and be an ally in Congress. Happy #NationalComingOutDay ! 🏳️‍🌈

Attempts to silence those who differ as occurred in Frederick last week go against the values that define our country. I am committed to leading with civility. It’s something we need as we approach this election and beyond.

Diversity in all its forms – where we come from how we worship who we love and even who we vote for – is a source of America’s strength. But with diversity must come respect and tolerance. https://t.co/x7eGBQ40nV

Thank you to @BrianFrosh and @GovLarryHogan for this important work on behalf of Marylanders. Now more than ever we need to work together to help citizens stay safe and healthy and housing is an important part of that. https://t.co/JUHmOAyKlV

I'm delighted to see this project get underway bringing over 1500 jobs to the Hagerstown area. When leaders at every level of government work together this is what we can accomplish. A great day for Washington County! https://t.co/1DhmjxriBU
Joe and Kamala are the team that will do what it takes to tackle the serious problems in front of us. #BidenHarris #VOTE

The refusal to admit Curt Flood to the Baseball Hall of Fame is an injustice that can and should be fixed. Proud to make the case for righting this wrong with my friend and colleague @WhipClyburn in this op-ed.  https://t.co/57Bg6FaAKr

The President postponing COVID relief until after the election is wrong and hurts Maryland families. I’m happy to see Gov. Hogan agree with me that the administration should act now to help families and businesses suffering through no fault of their own.  https://t.co/rLFuS74RHB

The President says no relief until after the election. Wrong. Powell is spot on — the economy needs immediate help. People need help to get to work put food on the table and care for their families – not political grandstanding. The time to act is now. https://t.co/FD7mChD6Ld
.@JoeBiden Welcome to #MD06 Mr. Vice President. Looking forward to having you back as Mr. President. https://t.co/bO2hDe8OYB

The President is wrong. He’s been slow to react and resistant to advice from medical experts. 7.5 million Americans have had this disease including 209000 who have died. They know it’s a serious threat whether the President does or not. https://t.co/Ix9QPfCtIP
Congress must ensure that these meal programs are funded. We have a duty to safeguard the health and wellbeing of those who are struggling.

Over 20 million Americans are going hungry every week and the number will increase as COVID-19 continues to take its toll on our country and our economy. Many of these families rely on federal benefits to keep food on the table. https://t.co/qX9nrzsrOc

Only 30 days are left before the most important election in our lifetime. Get involved NOW. Do everything you can to protect our democracy and move our country forward. We can't sit on the sidelines for this one. Click below to sign up. https://t.co/qBqOacdQCB
This bill is a great next step towards that goal. While this was a success there's much more to do. I'll never stop fighting.

I'm proud to announce that the House unanimously passed my bill this week to provide much needed help to families impacted by addiction. I came to Congress adamant that we could be doing more to end the opioid epidemic.https://t.co/0xvAxKjwxH
I believe in governing with compassion civility and competence. Donald Trump showed us this evening that he does not. Mr. President the American people were listening tonight. You should be ashamed.

TONIGHT: Join me with @BrianFrosh and special guests for a discussion on What's At Stake: What a Third Trump Supreme Court Justice Will Mean for America starting at 5:30pm. Tune in before the first Presidential Debate! Click the link below to register. https://t.co/UBO8TALGlW

The result will be millions of America's most vulnerable losing access to coverage. Those with pre-existing conditions lower income workers and families will suffer at the hands of a President trying to leave a legacy.

Access to affordable quality health care is a fundamental right but Trump is doing everything he can to take it away. Now he’s trying to stack the Supreme Court with Justices who will do his dirty work.  https://t.co/M0XJ2oEZH6
We are just 38 days from a Presidential Election. For the sake of our democracy this nomination must wait until the American people can make their voices heard.

President Trump has nominated Amy Coney Barrett to fill the open SC seat. I adamantly believe that this nomination shouldn't be considered by the Senate. This isn't based on Judge Barrett's merits it's based on the standard set by the Senate GOP in 2016. https://t.co/RYl7onyRYg

That's why I introduced the Family Support Services for Addiction Act alongside numerous other bipartisan bills to combat this problem. Beating this will take work from all levels of government and in our communities and I'm committed to continuing to be a part of this fight.

Overdose deaths are up 50% in Western Maryland during COVID-19. These numbers represent real people -- family friends neighbors and colleagues. There is much more work to do to end this crisis. https://t.co/k3qXpmlYJA

You know that mail-in voting is safe and secure -- you voted by mail yourself. Now is not the time to stoke fear and paranoia. The results of November’s election must be respected and a peaceful transfer of power must occur. Our country depends on it.

Mr. President our democracy is more important than you and we will do everything necessary to protect it.  For 4 years you have undermined the institutions and ideals that define who we are but rest assured that our voices will be heard this election. https://t.co/zV5TUCnZok
That hasn't happened. We need real reform accountability and justice now. This can't wait.

The cries for justice and accountability for Breonna Taylor have been ignored. For months thousands of Americans stood up and demanded justice for the countless Black Americans who have died at the hands of an unjust system.  https://t.co/l9q7LGafOb
Donald Trump failed these Americans by ignoring all of the warning signs and lying to the people. That's not leadership. https://t.co/T7JYNwJaH8
Now is the time to fight with all we’ve got to prevent Mitch from desecrating her memory and undermining our democratic institutions.

The rights of those with pre-existing conditions women immigrants and America's most vulnerable depend on a fair appointment process. Justice Ginsburg's dying wish was for her replacement to be nominated after a new President takes office.

Mitch McConnell and Senate Republicans want to ignore the standard they set in 2016 and ramrod a Supreme Court nomination through before November's election. There is too much at stake for us to allow that to happen. https://t.co/VkUKtnDz4N

This is the most important election of our lifetime. We can't sit on the sidelines this time. This National Voter Registration Day will you commit to checking your voter registration and reminding 5 friends to do the same? Our democracy depends on it. https://t.co/niPIwo6Sup
Those who died deserved a leader who took this seriously and listened to the experts not one obsessed with his public image. This is a sad day in our history.

200000 dead. We should never have come close to this grave milestone. President Trump's total incompetence and utter lack of compassion when it comes to leading our country through the COVID-19 pandemic is sickening.  https://t.co/AbL63wSL8y

She inspired generations with her larger than life persona and her wisdom. Our hearts are heavy and she will be sorely missed but her legacy will leave it’s impact on our democracy for generations to come.

Ruth Bader Ginsburg will go down in American history as so much more than a Supreme Court Justice. She was a champion for equality a pioneer of women’s rights and a visionary for justice. https://t.co/uGr6yQZlof
Shana Tova! June and I wish you and your families a happy and healthy New Year. May 5781 be a year of peace for our community our nation and our world. https://t.co/YQMTCma82P

Flagrant and divisive comments like this prove that there is much more work to be done to end institutional and systemic racism across our country in part because Trump and his AG keep behaving like racists.

I couldn't agree more with my friend @WhipClyburn. Attorney General Barr comparing life-saving restrictions to slavery is reprehensible and a disgrace to his office and the Department of Justice.  https://t.co/IF2szBR5f0
He failed them their families and their friends by ignoring warnings from the experts and downplaying the threat. And now he blames them. Have you no shame Mr. President?
Most of the almost 200000 Americans who have died during this pandemic didn't care about partisanship or politics. They needed leadership that this President did not deliver.
Now the President blames COVID-19 deaths in "blue states" like Maryland for making him look bad. To him the statistics and his politics are more important than those lives. https://t.co/aUfOcq4UBT

Congratulations to @SarahEMcBride on your historic victory last night! I continue to be inspired by your advocacy and action and I have no doubt that you will be an excellent Senator. On to November!  https://t.co/zpBQ9q8Z2T

Governing with civility and competence means looking past partisan politics and fighting for what's right for those you represent. The health and safety of Americans is not a partisan issue and I won't treat it as such. Read below to learn more.

This pandemic has proven that we aren't doing enough to be prepared for emergencies like this and that's why I've introduced bipartisan bills to strengthen our medical supply chain and make critical supplies here in America.  https://t.co/RJPfDXQ9Vc
He is undoubtedly an American hero and it is my privilege to introduce this bill in the House to honor him accordingly.

There is no doubt that Corporal Woodson's bravery and tenacity that day on Omaha Beach saved lives. But his Medal of Honor was withheld because of the color of his skin an injustice all too familiar to men and women of color in our country. https://t.co/t3ks65Lxqf

Hagerstown Regional Airport is an important gateway to Western Maryland. While the pandemic continues to take its toll on our economy we need to continue to invest in these opportunities to connect our smaller communities and help them grow and thrive.  https://t.co/RRRFSpQrGl

Today we honor the thousands of Americans who perished on 9/11 and mourn the tragedy our nation faced. In a time of tremendous adversity we were united. That spirit of unity and courage carried us forward. We should never forget that terrible day or the unity that helped us heal.

Downplaying a deadly virus is not effective leadership. The truth is had Trump taken this seriously and worked with Congress to manage it thousands of our family friends and neighbors would still be alive. This attitude is shameful and dangerous.   https://t.co/JkuHYqSxSf
Proud to see @JoeBiden's new plan to Make it in America this morning. Fighting alongside @LeaderHoyer Joe will get it done.

I don’t care if it costs a buck more to make it in America we need to buy American made goods. That’s particularly important for critical medical supplies that keep us safe during this and the next global crisis.  https://t.co/nFweqhEBwF
It was my honor to spend some time at Community Rescue Service in Hagerstown recently with my friend Emily Keller to learn more about what government should be doing to support them.

Our first responders have been fighting two public health crises recently: the COVID-19 pandemic and the opioid epidemic. Their dedication to public health and safety is critical to keeping our communities safe.  https://t.co/XydTIm9Qtl

Thanks to unions the American workplace has changed for the better. But we can't stop here. @JoeBiden knows that. This year it's been American workers who helped us stay afloat. Joe will treat all of them as essential and help our country build back better. #BidenHarris2020

Today let's reflect on the contributions workers across the country and the labor movement have made to our progress and focus our attention on what needs to be done to keep the promise of the American Dream alive for everyone – especially those who make this country work.

Happy Labor Day! American unions have been at the forefront of progress for decades and this year is no exception. Countless frontline workers have kept our country running and put their health and safety on the line to support all of us throughout this pandemic. https://t.co/3XJAbMv6a9

Cumberland residents have witnessed firsthand how our crumbling infrastructure impacts daily living. City bridges have been a problem for far too long and I was happy to spend the afternoon with Mayor Morriss talking about the solutions we’re working on. https://t.co/cU8GgQN1ix

President Trump can keep up the charade of being a proud Commander in Chief but make no mistake -- he has no respect for the men and women honorably serving their country. He didn't when the Russians put bounties on their heads and he doesn't now.  https://t.co/cqciPrPyr6

More members of our military are supporting @JoeBiden because they know the importance of having a level-headed and competent leader. Joe has shown during his time in government that their safety is his priority and will remain that way. #BidenHarris2020 https://t.co/6BcVDF5695

Shockingly the Trump administration is taking away rather than investing in health safety – all while they push to open schools. Protecting students and educators from COVID-19 is key to opening schools safely. They need to get their priorities straight. https://t.co/Ubj09C7Ivg

It’s outrageous that the Trump Administration saw fit to illegally divert billions in taxpayer dollars to an ineffective and immoral border wall but pinches pennies when it comes to ensuring our frontline workers have the PPE they need.  https://t.co/VmEiuCoUDe
I came to Congress prepared to fight until no more families have to suffer at the hands of addiction like mine did when we lost Ian. I hope you'll join me.
The pain of losing a loved one can be overwhelming. But if we turn that heartache into action and advocacy working together in our communities I know that we can beat this.

September is Recovery Month a time for us to celebrate those who have overcome their battle with addiction mourn those who we've lost and recommit ourselves to ending this crisis. https://t.co/gDfhlo46uU

Schools are back in session this week but Mitch McConnell still has the Heroes Act sitting on his desk. We need to make the investments laid out in the bill in order to keep students and educators safe. They can't afford any more inaction. https://t.co/MSS8zEQeIr

Anyone who believes they are a victim is encouraged to call Montgomery County Department of Police – Special Victims Investigations Division (SVID) detectives at 240-773-5400.  For the National Sexual Assault Hotline call 800.656.HOPE (4673).
I am shocked and sickened to hear about the charges against Maxwell Bero. Our first priority should be to make sure that any victim who comes forward gets the treatment and justice they deserve.

Systematic racism must be at the top of our action agenda. To start the shooting of Jacob Blake should be investigated and the Senate should pass the George Floyd Justice in Policing Act that the House passed in June. Immediately.

Today elected officials and citizens from across the district joined me in Gaithersburg to send a message to Trump and the Postmaster General: we need a postal service that works efficiently and effectively. This is no time to play politics. Too many people’s lives depend on it. https://t.co/iaWfv3mPMC

We’re in a battle for the soul of a nation. This election is a turning point for our democracy and @JoeBiden showed us tonight that he’s ready to take this fight head-on. Now is the time for all of us to stand beside Joe and make sure that we take our country back. #BidenHarris https://t.co/p2MJsfN5ys

So great to spend the morning speaking with Maryland’s DNC Delegates alongside my good friends @DougJones @SenatorCardin and @LeaderHoyer. One thing is clear: Maryland Democrats are fired up and ready to work tirelessly to elect @JoeBiden in November. Let’s do this! https://t.co/mo3e7xkuOL

Tonight @KamalaHarris showed why she will be a phenomenal Vice President.   She’s been fighting for the people her whole life & believes everyone deserves compassion dignity and respect. That is leadership.   She’s ready to do the work. And I’m ready to join her. #BidenHarris

The message from @BarackObama couldn’t have been clearer: if we don’t vote our democracy will wither until there is no democracy at all.   We cannot let them take away our power and our democracy. We must vote for @JoeBiden and @KamalaHarris. Our democracy depends on it.

.@SpeakerPelosi is a phenomenal leader who has led the fight in the House to pursue an agenda For the People.   As she said tonight it’s time to elect @JoeBiden take back the Senate and pass legislation that will make our country a better place for all people. #DemConvention

TONIGHT: Join me in watching Day 3 of the Democratic National Convention where we’ll hear the inspiring words of so many passionate Democrats including President Obama! Tune in here: https://t.co/cEaRFuD2cq #DemConvention

The Postmaster General needs to be removed immediately. Millions of Americans rely on the postal service every day. I refuse to stand by and watch this Administration tear down an institution that has been a pillar of our democracy for centuries. https://t.co/9YDsIyjWJ3

What a week to be a Marylander! It was wonderful to see @CouncilPresBMS and Bianca Shah representing our great state during the DNC roll call vote. Maryland Democrats couldn’t have picked two better people to show that we’re united for Biden!  https://t.co/GJZnIEZwjc
Tune in tonight from 9-11pm for Day 2 of the #DemConvention #BidenHarris   https://t.co/jN3Jxiqw9K

Last night we heard from Democrats and Republicans farmers and frontline workers & folks from every corner of the country about why we need @JoeBiden in the White House.   Joe can unite us. And as @MichelleObama said it's time to vote for Joe like our lives depend on it.

I am saddened to hear of Joseph Kitchen's passing. He embodied so many of the values that make the Democratic Party so strong and his passion for progress will be sorely missed. June and I are keeping his family in our thoughts and prayers.  https://t.co/6q6D8Bao4W
